agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Intergovernmental Relations TIME & DATE: 9:00 AM, Monday, March 25, 2019 PLACE: E1.028 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Eddie Lucio, Jr. The Senate Committee on Intergovernmental Relations will meet to consider the following: SB 286 Miles Relating to the power of certain counties to enact park use rules. SB 289 Lucio Relating to natural disaster housing recovery. SB 300 Miles Relating to indefinite quantity contracts for the provision of certain services to declared disaster areas following a natural disaster. SB 452 Fallon Relating to the authority of general-law municipalities to impose term limits on the members of their governing bodies. SB 790 Buckingham Relating to certain audit and reporting requirements of regional planning commissions. SB 1014 Perry Relating to facilities of the hospital system of the Reagan Hospital District of Reagan County, Texas. SB 1099 Buckingham Relating to the creation and operations of health care provider participation programs in certain counties. SB 1142 Watson Relating to authority of the Travis County Healthcare District to appoint, contract for, or employ physicians. SB 1236 Hall Relating to authority of the Hunt Memorial Hospital District to appoint, contract for, or employ physicians. SB 1253 Kolkhorst Relating to a public database maintained by the comptroller of information about certain political subdivisions. SB 1303 Bettencourt | et al. Relating to maps of the actual or proposed boundaries and extraterritorial jurisdiction of a municipality and certain notices related to expanding the boundaries. SB 1304 Bettencourt | et al. Relating to notice of proposed changes to municipal zoning classifications. SB 1545 Menéndez Relating to the creation and operations of a health care provider participation program by the Bexar County Hospital District. SB 1572 Alvarado Relating to municipal registration of vacant buildings. SB 1690 Perry Relating to the authority of the Lubbock County Hospital District of Lubbock County, Texas, to employ physicians. The Committee may also consider pending business. For members of the public who wish to provide oral testimony, please limit prepared remarks to three (3) minutes. If providing written testimony, please submit twenty (20) copies, with your name on each copy, to the Committee during the hearing. Copies will be distributed to Committee Members and will be part of our public record.
